LanguageData.DE_DepositFoodDesc: Toggle this to allow or forbid food deposits.
LanguageData.DE_CanOnlyPlantCavePlantsOnRottenSoil: Only fungal plants can grow on rotten soil.
LanguageData.DE_SporeModeDesc: Click to toggle between spore modes. Switching between modes takes 5 days. Current mode: {0}\n\n{1}
LanguageData.DE_OnlyFungalNexusCanHarvestThis: Only a fungal nexus can harvest this.
LanguageData.DE_OnlyNonSpecializedFungalGhoulsCanUseI: Only non-specialized fungal ghouls can use it
LanguageData.DE_OnlyFungalNexusWithThreeLargeServants: Only a fungal nexus with three or more large servants can start this ritual.
LanguageData.DE_ThreeLargeServantsRequired: Three large servants belonging to the fungal nexus are required for this ritual.
LanguageData.DE_SeekFoodDesc: Force this servant to seek and consume available food.
LanguageData.DE_SetServantTypeTargetDesc: Choose which type of servant to prioritize when reanimating corpses. The burrowers will try to infect corpses of this type when possible.
LanguageData.DE_MustBuildOnRottenSoil: Must be placed on rotten soil.
LanguageData.DE_TriggerDeathPallDesc: Using bioferrite's strange properties, the spores dispersed in the air by the cloudmaker can reanimate the dead as "proto-servants". Loyal to their collective but still short lived, they they claw and bite at the living.
LanguageData.DE_DeathPallCooldown: Death pall is on cooldown for {0}.
LanguageData.DE_OnlyFungalNexusWithThreeLargeServants: Only a fungal nexus with three or more large servants and a sightstealer servant can start this ritual.
LanguageData.DE_SightstealerRequired: A sightstealer belonging to the fungal nexus is required for this ritual.
LanguageData.DE_NeedRawFungusForCosmeticChange: {0} raw fungus required for cosmetic change.
LanguageData.DE_ShowMushroomCapTooltip: If enabled, the fungal nexus pawn will render its mushroom cap.
LanguageData.DE_UseTimelessHeadTooltip: If enabled, the fungal nexus pawn will use the Timeless head type, overriding their original head.
LanguageData.DE_Research_ShardDuplication_Description: By using human minds as a computation medium, replicating archotech shards becomes possible. Only for the low cost of a human life.
LanguageData.DE_Ritual_ShardDuplication_Description: A human mind is no different than that of an archotech. While they operate at different levels of complexity, they are, at their core, simply computers. Thus a shard of archotechnology, as unknowable as it is, should be able to be produced by either minds. By subjecting a human to intense sensory deprivation we can completely disrupt the normal functions of the mind and cause the human's psyche to fracture. Once that is done, the shard can "share" its computations with the newly broken mind to create something new, dedicating the mind and body to the creation of more shards. The price for such immense knowledge is the complete and utter annihilation of the subject. This ritual is more effective if the subject has high psychic sensitivity.
LanguageData.DE_RitualTargetPsychicallyDeaf: {PAWN_labelShort} is psychically deaf and cannot be used as a target for this ritual.
LanguageData.DE_Ritual_ShardDuplication_Success: {TARGET_labelShort} was consumed by the ritual, producing {1} shards.
LanguageData.DE_Ritual_ShardDuplication_Failure: The ritual failed to properly harness {TARGET_labelShort}'s psyche. The victim was consumed, but no shards were produced.
LanguageData.DE_PrintMealDesc: Force the fungal node to produce one slurry meal for its usual cost.
LanguageData.DE_NotEnoughFoodToPrintMeal: Not enough food stored to print a meal.
LanguageData.DE_CerebrumMatured: A Cerebrum has reached maturity and can now be harvested.
LanguageData.DE_LivingDressBonded: The living dress has bonded with {0}.
LanguageData.DE_LivingDressDevoured: {0}'s living dress has devoured {1}, gaining {2} healing.
LanguageData.DE_LivingDressAlreadyBonded: The living dress is already bonded to another pawn.
LanguageData.DE_DevourAbilityInvalidTarget: Invalid target. Must be a fresh corpse.
LanguageData.DE_SelectWorldDestination: Select a destination on the world map.
LanguageData.DE_NotEnoughBioferriteForTeleport: Not enough bioferrite for teleport. Required: {0}, Available: {1}.
LanguageData.DE_SelectDestinationDesc: Select a destination on the world map for the quantum tunnel.
LanguageData.DE_ReturnToOriginDesc: Return to the original gate location.
LanguageData.DE_QuantumTunnelingSuccess: The ritual was a success! A quantum tunnel gate has opened.
LanguageData.DE_QuantumTunnelingFailure: The ritual failed. The archotech shards were consumed, but no quantum tunnel gate appeared.
LanguageData.DE_NoDropSpotAvailable: No valid drop spot available at the destination.
LanguageData.DE_LaunchTeleportDesc: Launch the quantum tunnel teleport to the selected destination after consuming the required bioferrite.
LanguageData.DE_CloseGateDesc: Close this quantum tunnel gate, destroying it permanently.
